comments.raw_text:
When an element has a title attribute, and a tooltip is being displayed on mouseover of that element, setCapture on that element appears to have no effect, in the sense that mousemove events are not delivered to that element when the cursor leaves that element.

See the attached test case.

I verified this on Firefox 5 on Linux, and Firefox 6 on Mac.

Test case that illustrates bug

When an element has a title attribute, and a tooltip is being displayed on mouseover of that element, setCapture on that element appears to have no effect, in the sense that mousemove events are not delivered to that element when the cursor leaves that element.

See the attached test case.

I verified this on Firefox 5 on Linux, and Firefox 6 on Mac.

Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:9.0a1) Gecko/20110831 Firefox/9.0a1

STR:
 1. Open the test case attached by the reporter.
 2. Try to drag the green square.
 3. Keep the mouse over the green square until the tooltip is displayed, then try dragging it again.

Expected Results:
 The square can be dragged without any issues both times and it remains where the user releases the mouse click.

Actaul Results:
 The square can be dragged without any issues both times but at step 3 the square returns to its initial position when the user releases the mouse click.
